People would stop dead in their tracks, hands on hips and say horrible things to us! And this is in the 21st Century! There were times I would actively dissuade my husband from showing me any affection in a Black environment because I didn't want the brothers to take it the wrong way and think it was an overt slap in their face-- you know, white man comes up in to the Black neighborhood to claim the Black woman while the Black man stands idly by. But after a time, I got over it. My man was just trying to love me. He was willing to take all the insults and stand by me and allow me to open myself up and let him in, so to speak. And I am so glad I did. I have been fortunate in having had positive relationships with all of the men I have dated seriously (who btw, were all Black). They all brought something special to the table. My husband just happened to come into my life at the right time when I was opening up to the idea of trying "something new". I have learned a lot from him, but he has also learned a lot from me. I think this movie did SO much in the way of allowing people to get a little more used to the idea that love comes in all shapes sizes and colors, and that it also comes with problems, depending on the type of relationship. Interracial relationships are going to always have family and societal disapproval, but guess what, everyone comes around eventually once they realized that it's not superficial, that there's true, honest love there. This is because people are just people, and if someone takes the time to get to know you, you discover all the things you have in common that have nothing to do with skin color. The moral of this extended post is this: After we had been dating for some time, my husband moved up to Harlem. Before you knew it, he was friends with everybody on the block and knew more people in my neighborhood than I did. That's because people are just afraid of what they don't know. Yes there is a lot of historical baggage attached to race in this country, but we can't keep schleping it around with us all the time, we've got to let it go, let it flow. I encourage all of you to see the movie. It was your typical predictable rom com, yes, where everything works out okay in the end, but it also has a lot to recommend it. I thought it was on point and funny and sad and all that good stuff. Go see it! (Plus it's the first studio film that's written, directed, produced and starred in by Black women!) You go ladies!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12864,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"duration":"PT1H39M"</script><metacontent="

Upon learning that their mother has been lying to them for years about their allegedly deceased father, two fraternal twin brothers hit the road in order to find him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1966359/","name":"Father Figures","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3MDQ4MDI1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYxMjcxNDM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005562/","name":"Owen Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159180/","name":"Ed Helms"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000335/","name":"Glenn Close"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003394/","name":"Lawrence Sher"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054452/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020509/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118469/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3675159/","name":"Justin Malen"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4284725529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2NzA0NzA0Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjEwNzk2MzI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2NzA0NzA0Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjEwNzk2MzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Wilson and Helms are Kyle and Peter Reynolds, brothers whose eccentric mother raised them to believe their father had died when they were young. When they discover this to be a lie, they set out together to find their real father, and end up learning more about their mother than they probably ever wanted to know."},"datePublished":"2017-12-22","description":"Upon learning that their mother has been lying to them for years about their allegedly deceased father, two fraternal twin brothers hit the road in order to find him.","keywords":"fool,chump,craziness,silliness,idiot","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1966359/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"namashi_1"},"dateCreated":"2018-05-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Better Than What The Critics Said!","reviewBody":"'Father Figures' is no great movie. But it isn't a bad movie either. At least not as bad as the critics called it. Its, at its very core, a very watchable comedy, that, believe it or not, has got a heart too.

'Father Figures' Synopsis: Upon learning that their mother has been lying to them for years about their allegedly deceased father, two fraternal twin brothers hit the road in order to find him.

'Father Figures' is a tale of two brothers, who go on a journey to find their real dad, but end up exploring each other more than they could've imagined. And this story, though monotonous after a point, has some funny jokes that land & the banter between its brothers, has moments that evoke mirth & some genuine emotion too. I found myself emotionally connected in the film's concluding moments, which I least expected too. Having said that, there is no denying that 'Father Figures' gets repetitive & even some of its jokes don't land. Also, the length could've been trimmed by 10-15 minutes.

Justin Malen's Screenplay is a mixed bag, but there are some nice things here, that leave a mark. Lawrence Sher's Direction is adequate. Cinematography is satisfactory. Editing could've been tighter. Art & Costume Design are standard.

Performance-Wise: Owen Wilson & Ed Helms are extremely likable. Both of the terrific actors add a lot to their roles & excel in the comedic & emotional bits. The Legendary Glenn Close appears in a cameo as the mother of the boys & as usual, lends grace to the part. Among the dads, Terry Bradshaw is fun to watch, J. K. Simmons wild & The Great Christopher Walken gets barely anything to do. Ving Rhames & Katt Williams are funny. 

On the whole, 'Father Figures' is an entirely watchable comedy, that has its pros & cons. Not a bad Sunday noon watch!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18719,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

As most of the things in the Balkans happen, he is destined to failure." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0061855/","name":"Kad budem mrtav i beo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmI0YjcyMGQtM2NkMC00MjkyLTg0OTItN2NlZTRmOWMyOTljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjk0ODkxMjQ@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama","Music"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631877/","name":"Dragan Nikolic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0812408/","name":"Ruzica Sokic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0817135/","name":"Neda Spasojevic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0667870/","name":"Zivojin Pavlovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069692/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0468999/","name":"Ljubisa Kozomara"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0586235/","name":"Gordan Mihic"}],"datePublished":"1967-12-27","description":"The story about Jimmy the Dingy, a young vagabond who works as a seasonal worker. Having been sacked from the job, his dreams are to become a singer. As most of the things in the Balkans happen, he is destined to failure.","keywords":"yugoslav black wave,color in title","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0061855/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"anticurous"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Harsh, yet beautiful reality","reviewBody":"A gem of Yugoslav/Serbian cinematography! The movie represents an interesting stream in cinema history that is called ''Yugoslavian black wave'', which portrays life in a newly formed socialistic republic of Yugoslavia. Comprised of six republics and a yet a few cities, it is a dominantly rural environment. Young people become developing ambitions and dreams like their fellow young people in Western Europe and the US, all the while struggling with the repressive regime and all the nonsense that comes with it. Dragan Nikolic, one of Serbia's most beloved actors fantastically plays a young attractive man who has no limits when it comes for wanting to live a better life! Plus, an interesting thing for cinema lovers! There were to main movie waves in Yugoslavia - ''black wave'' and ''red wave'', the black wave shows the struggles of living in a freshly formed communist country from the perspective of ordinary people, while the ''red wave'' shows exactly the opposite - brave Partizans who fought Germans. Highly recommend both waves if you're interested in discovering the unique mentality of Serbian people.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1107,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"duration":"PT1H19M"}</script><metacontent="

Having been sacked from the job, his dreams are to become a singer. As most of the things in the Balkans happen, he is destined to failure.","keywords":"yugoslav black wave,color in title","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0061855/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"anticurous","dateCreated":"2020-05-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Harsh, yet beautiful reality","reviewBody":"A gem of Yugoslav/Serbian cinematography! The movie represents an interesting stream in cinema history that is called ''Yugoslavian black wave'', which portrays life in a newly formed socialistic republic of Yugoslavia. Comprised of six republics and a yet a few cities, it is a dominantly rural environment. Young people become developing ambitions and dreams like their fellow young people in Western Europe and the US, all the while struggling with the repressive regime and all the nonsense that comes with it. Dragan Nikolic, one of Serbia's most beloved actors fantastically plays a young attractive man who has no limits when it comes for wanting to live a better life! Plus, an interesting thing for cinema lovers! There were to main movie waves in Yugoslavia - ''black wave'' and ''red wave'', the black wave shows the struggles of living in a freshly formed communist country from the perspective of ordinary people, while the ''red wave'' shows exactly the opposite - brave Partizans who fought Germans. Highly recommend both waves if you're interested in discovering the unique mentality of Serbian people.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1107,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"duration":"PT1H19M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Opklada
Opklada
programme.desc: Directed by Zdravko Randic. With Dusica Zegarac, Boris Dvornik, Pavle Vuisic, Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic. A young woman leaves her older husband, the owner of a village mill, for a truck driver whom she met while he was in their village by business. While trying to find him, she experiences the life in suburbia, and gets back to her husband disappointed, disgraced and humiliated.

credits.actor: Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic, Dragomir Felba, Pavle Vuisić, Dušica Žegarac

programme.title: Brat doktora Homera
Brat doktora Homera
programme.desc:
Brat doktora Homera: Directed by Zivorad 'Zika' Mitrovic. With Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic, Vojislav Miric, Jovan Milicevic, Ljuba Tadic. This film predominantly deals with the problems of a young man whom his delusions led into conflict with society. These issues will throw him into an adventure that would be tragic for him, but still helpful for him to see the truth. The story takes place in Kosovo in 1945, in an atmosphere of uncured wounds, wandering, betrayal, burned homes, typhoid and other postwar misery. An authentic story from those days was taken as the film's basis." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0172193/","name":"Brat doktora Homera","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWE1MTU4MjItMThlYi00MmQxLTk0ZmMtYzgwNWJlOGJhNGMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjU0MjU2MjI@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0957372/","name":"Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0592364/","name":"Vojislav Miric"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0587432/","name":"Jovan Milicevic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0594020/","name":"Zivorad 'Zika' Mitrovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069692/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0594020/","name":"Zivorad 'Zika' Mitrovic"}],"datePublished":"1968-02-23","description":"This film predominantly deals with the problems of a young man whom his delusions led into conflict with society. These issues will throw him into an adventure that would be tragic for him, but still helpful for him to see the truth.","keywords":"yugoslav western,ostern,eastern,spaghetti western,insanity","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0172193/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dima-12"},"dateCreated":"2005-08-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the greatest Yugoslav films of all time!","reviewBody":"BRAT DOKTORA HOMERA is a masterpiece made by one of the greatest Serbian directors of all time, Zivorad 'Zika' Mitrovic, who passed away this winter as 2005 was dawning.

BRAT DOKTORA HOMERA belongs to the wave of Yugoslav Westerns, films which were shaped along the aesthetic of Hollywood Western and based on events from WW/2. Mitrovic was often criticized for such approach, especially by the Communist hardliners who believed that such genre dogmatics make fun out of their revolutionary achievements. And yet, Mitrovic's unique craft remained undisputed so he ended up as one of the most respected State Directors of Tito's era.

BRAT DOKTORA HOMERA is a potent revenge tale set in 1945, in the turbulent region of Kosovo where tensions escalated in 1981 and caused the NATO bombing in 1999. Mitrovic's opus was Kosovo-obsessed. He adored its' beautiful and brutal landscape, reminiscent of John Ford's Monument Valley. He also realized the full potential of its' unresolved political and ethnic situation. By the end of 1945, Kosovo was split evenly between Serbs and Albanians. Hardliner Albanian renegades, who used to be allied with Nazis, kept raging on, long after Germany surrendered. Yugoslav authorities responded by unprecedented deployment of security forces who oppressed the whole region in order to respond to the renegade challenge. Inevitably, oppression led to excessive force and corruption. This war-torn world was an ideal setting for the Serbian brand of Westerns and Mitrovic fully utilized that potential.

At the same time, Kosovo itself contained a rich esotheric meaning. Since the medieval times, it remained the mythical cornerstone of Serbian culture and nationalgeist. Thus, just like Wild West, it is an ideal imaginary territory, quite potent setting for different genre experiments.

BRAT DOKTORA HOMERA is a story of Simon, the flamboyant son of the local judge who comes home after four years in a German P.O.W. camp. Upon arrival, he realizes that his old flame found consolation in his brother's arms and that his father was killed. Unlike his brother, Simon passionately investigates father's death and finds out that the well-known criminal who allegedly killed him actually was a patsy while the murderer is still at large. The chaotic atmosphere of gang-riddled Kosovo enables Simon to seek retribution.

Velimir Bata Zivojinovic, the greatest star of Yugoslav cinema, stars as Simon, delivering a rugged and involving performance along the lines of Oliver Reed or Lee Marvin. Mitrovic masterfully frames him and turns Simon into an engaging Western hero.

Even though Simon doesn't have the mythical proportions of Leone's Blondie, this character is absolutely synchronized with the bad-asses of his era.

Mitrovic's screen writing is tight and he manages to create a believable world for Simon to live in. The most important part of Mitrovic's crafty writing is the ability to turn huge melodramatic twists into plausible screen gestures.

Mitrovic's direction is as tight. He has an eye for cinematic elements. He uses the actors and locations up to the limit of their photogenic potential. Thanks to then young and prospective director of photography Branko Ivatovic, Mitrovic manages to utilize the colorful settings and add some beauty to the gritty affair he wrote. BRAT DOKTORA HOMERA was delivered thirteen years after John Sturgess' BAD DAY AT BLACK ROCK and it has such resonant atmosphere. It was released same year as Sergio Leone's ONCE UPON A TIME IN THE WEST which stood as the greatest Western achievement at that point. BRAT DOKTORA HOMERA lives through comparison with each of these titles even though Mitrovic's direction seems to be too muscular to take this title into the art-house crossover territory where both Leone and Sturgess wound up.

BRAT DOKTORA HOMERA is happy to remain the greatest Yugoslav Western and a confident programmer that keeps pleasantly surprising audience up to this day. This film also remains as a symbol of an era when Yugoslav films were able to stand any comparison with the elite Hollywood and European works, even in the world of action cinema.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":147,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

Sabirni centar
programme.desc: Sabirni centar: Directed by Goran Markovic. With Rade Markovic, Bogdan Diklic, Dragan Nikolic, Olivera Markovic. During the excavation of ancient Roman ruins, an old archaeology professor accidentally opens the gate between our world and the world of the dead." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0122234/","name":"Sabirni centar","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDA1ZDE5Y2QtMmQwMy00MmQ4LTliNGYtODQ1MTk0MDk1MzU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548589/","name":"Rade Markovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0226699/","name":"Bogdan Diklic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631877/","name":"Dragan Nikolic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020556/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076116/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0468169/","name":"Dusan Kovacevic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"datePublished":"1989-07-19","description":"During the excavation of ancient Roman ruins, an old archaeology professor accidentally opens the gate between our world and the world of the dead.","keywords":"professor,suicide,satire,assistant,year 1969","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0122234/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kont_ejnerovski"},"dateCreated":"2007-02-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Masterpiece","reviewBody":"This is a great movie. See why the dead can't find peace, because of us the alive. It is hard to see greatness of this film if you don't understand Serbian. Movie starts when professor Misa find the one thing what he was searching all his life-the passage. Soon after, he dies. The dead in their world, are one by one disappointed by things that happened in the world of a living. And when the professor Misa who died recently find out what is happening in the world of a living by his pupil who committed suicide after Misa's death, he find the passage similar to one on earth. The dead go on a journey to correct the things.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2745,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Davitelj protiv davitelja
Davitelj protiv davitelja
programme.desc:
Davitelj protiv davitelja: Directed by Slobodan Sijan. With Tasko Nacic, Nikola Simic, Srdjan Saper, Sonja Savic. A mentally disturbed flower seller starts killing young girls on the streets of Belgrade. While the frustrated police inspector is trying to stop him, an aspiring musician finds his life and work deeply intertwined with that of a killer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0087123/","name":"Davitelj protiv davitelja","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjk0YjgwMDQtZTU2Ny00ZTZkLWFlNWItOWJkMWI3ZmJkNzc4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzIwMTIwODc@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0618705/","name":"Tasko Nacic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799509/","name":"Nikola Simic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0764543/","name":"Srdjan Saper"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0797672/","name":"Slobodan Sijan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0657033/","name":"Nebojsa Pajkic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0797672/","name":"Slobodan Sijan"}],"datePublished":"1984-06-18","description":"A mentally disturbed flower seller starts killing young girls on the streets of Belgrade. While the frustrated police inspector is trying to stop him, an aspiring musician finds his life and work deeply intertwined with that of a kil","keywords":"three word title,orchestra,conductor,strangling,bank","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0087123/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sttanislav"},"dateCreated":"2005-12-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"What makes city a city?","reviewBody":"What makes city a city? What makes it different than a village? Is it the traffic jam? The people who live there? Or is it something else? 

According to this movie, the criminals and gangsters define the city. While London has Jack the Ripper, Belgrade has his "davitelj", i.e. the strangler. That's how begins an interesting movie, "Davitelj protiv davitelja" a mix of comedy and horror. It is a story about a guy, flower seller, who turns into a mad man, and commits a series of crimes. Also, we have a police inspector who is trying to stop him. The inspector is getting a lot of help and "help" from a young rock singer and a girl working in a local radio-station. To make the picture complete, there is also a strangler's mother, a character inspired by the Hitchcock's Psycho.

The movie is amusing, I liked it, but people expecting an exceptional movie, like "Ko to tamo peva" or "Maratonci trce pocasni krug", director's earlier works, will be disappointed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3305,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

While the frustrated police inspector is trying to stop him, an aspiring musician finds his life and work deeply intertwined with that of a kil","keywords":"three word title,orchestra,conductor,strangling,bank","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0087123/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"sttanislav","dateCreated":"2005-12-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"What makes city a city?","reviewBody":"What makes city a city? What makes it different than a village? Is it the traffic jam? The people who live there? Or is it something else? 

According to this movie, the criminals and gangsters define the city. While London has Jack the Ripper, Belgrade has his "davitelj", i.e. the strangler. That's how begins an interesting movie, "Davitelj protiv davitelja" a mix of comedy and horror. It is a story about a guy, flower seller, who turns into a mad man, and commits a series of crimes. Also, we have a police inspector who is trying to stop him. The inspector is getting a lot of help and "help" from a young rock singer and a girl working in a local radio-station. To make the picture complete, there is also a strangler's mother, a character inspired by the Hitchcock's Psycho.

The movie is amusing, I liked it, but people expecting an exceptional movie, like "Ko to tamo peva" or "Maratonci trce pocasni krug", director's earlier works, will be disappointed.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3305,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"duration":"PT1H33M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dogodilo se na danasnji dan
Dogodilo se na današnji dan
programme.desc:
Dogodilo se na danasnji dan: Directed by Miroslav Lekic. With Zarko Lausevic, Srdjan 'Zika' Todorovic, Olja Beckovic, Nebojsa Bakocevic. Belgrade in 1963. In a yard surrounded by buildings, a group of young people of different backgrounds and social status, but of similar views about love and self-affirmation, spend their time together. Their friendship is dyed with various events typical for socialism, such as working actions or Youth Day's parade. All what happens within this yard may become an allegory of one generation's destiny." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0181498/","name":"Dogodilo se na danasnji dan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2I3Nzc3YmMtZGIzNS00YWUwLTg5Y2QtMjY5ODllNjM2Mzg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc0MTYwMDE@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0491551/","name":"Zarko Lausevic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0865411/","name":"Srdjan 'Zika' Todorovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065858/","name":"Olja Beckovic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0500867/","name":"Miroslav Lekic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076116/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0500867/","name":"Miroslav Lekic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0504032/","name":"Deana Leskovar"}],"datePublished":"1987-06-28","description":"Belgrade in 1963. In a yard surrounded by buildings, a group of young people of different backgrounds and social status, but of similar views about love and self-affirmation, spend their time together. Their friendship is dyed with v","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0181498/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"riba-lav"},"dateCreated":"2007-08-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"komentarisacu na srpskom :)","reviewBody":"The film is great! Laugh and a seriosity. It has been so many times on TV, I don t know, I think many, many filmofils have watched it.

The great actors, for some of them one of the first movies. The people from ex - Yugoslavia know when hear: Zarko Lausevic, Srdjan Todorovic, Zoran Cvijanovic, Vesna Trivalic, etc that it is quality film.

You will laugh, focus on Srdjan Todorovic ( Males ),

but it isn t a comedy, at the end of the movie, you get serious! A Belgrade neighbourhood: the main characters are 18 - 25 years old, young people. Growing up, love problems,social problems... 

A realistic story, the 70-es in Belgrade...

I strongly recommend it! Specially for those who like Zarko Lausevic","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":293,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kad budem mrtav i beo
Kad budem mrtav i beo
programme.desc: Kad budem mrtav i beo: Directed by Zivojin Pavlovic. With Dragan Nikolic, Ruzica Sokic, Neda Spasojevic, Dara Calenic. The story about Jimmy the Dingy, a young vagabond who works as a seasonal worker. Having been sacked from the job, his dreams are to become a singer. As most of the things in the Balkans happen, he is destined to failure." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0061855/","name":"Kad budem mrtav i beo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmI0YjcyMGQtM2NkMC00MjkyLTg0OTItN2NlZTRmOWMyOTljXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjk0ODkxMjQ@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama","Music"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631877/","name":"Dragan Nikolic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0812408/","name":"Ruzica Sokic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0817135/","name":"Neda Spasojevic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0667870/","name":"Zivojin Pavlovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069692/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0468999/","name":"Ljubisa Kozomara"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0586235/","name":"Gordan Mihic"}],"datePublished":"1967-12-27","description":"The story about Jimmy the Dingy, a young vagabond who works as a seasonal worker. Having been sacked from the job, his dreams are to become a singer. As most of the things in the Balkans happen, he is destined to failure.","keywords":"yugoslav black wave,color in title","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0061855/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"anticurous"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Harsh, yet beautiful reality","reviewBody":"A gem of Yugoslav/Serbian cinematography! The movie represents an interesting stream in cinema history that is called ''Yugoslavian black wave'', which portrays life in a newly formed socialistic republic of Yugoslavia. Comprised of six republics and a yet a few cities, it is a dominantly rural environment. Young people become developing ambitions and dreams like their fellow young people in Western Europe and the US, all the while struggling with the repressive regime and all the nonsense that comes with it. Dragan Nikolic, one of Serbia's most beloved actors fantastically plays a young attractive man who has no limits when it comes for wanting to live a better life! Plus, an interesting thing for cinema lovers! There were to main movie waves in Yugoslavia - ''black wave'' and ''red wave'', the black wave shows the struggles of living in a freshly formed communist country from the perspective of ordinary people, while the ''red wave'' shows exactly the opposite - brave Partizans who fought Germans. Highly recommend both waves if you're interested in discovering the unique mentality of Serbian people.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1107,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"duration":"PT1H19M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Opklada
Opklada
programme.desc: Directed by Zdravko Randic. With Dusica Zegarac, Boris Dvornik, Pavle Vuisic, Velimir 'Bata' Zivojinovic. A young woman leaves her older husband, the owner of a village mill, for a truck driver whom she met while he was in their village by business. While trying to find him, she experiences the life in suburbia, and gets back to her husband disappointed, disgraced and humiliated.

programme.desc: Poslednja trka: Directed by Jovan Rancic. With Vladimir Buljan, Mirjana Jokovic, Bogoljub Petrovic, Pavle Vuisic. Zoran, a twelve-year-old son of divorced parents, lives in a skyscraper, but the drab of urban living is somewhat improved by the proximity of a hippodrome and a horse farm. Zoran's favorite horse is a former champion named Zimzelen (Evergreen), a stud whom the administration decides to sell to the slaughterhouse. After an unsuccessful attempt to change their mind, Zoran and his friends steal the horse and disappear. IMDb data; ttnr: 0180923, Title: Poslednja trka, --- Description: Poslednja trka: Directed by Jovan Rancic. With Vladimir Buljan, Mirjana Jokovic, Bogoljub Petrovic, Pavle Vuisic. Zoran, a twelve-year-old son of divorced parents, lives in a skyscraper, but the drab of urban living is somewhat improved by the proximity of a hippodrome and a horse farm. programme.title: Tesna koza
Tesna koža
programme.desc: Directed by Milivoje 'Mica' Milosevic. With Nikola Simic, Milan 'Lane' Gutovic, Rahela Ferari, Ruzica Sokic. In this light, fluffy comedy, a low-level clerk cannot make ends meet because his brood is in no way economically cooperative: his daughter is a lawyer looking for work, unsuccessfully; his son is a would-be astronomer who wants to spend his life studying without working; and his other son wants his own wheels. It is enough to send a father to the lottery, or to the soccer pool.

credits.actor: Nikola Simić, Milan 'Lane' Gutovic, Rahela Ferari, Ružica Sokić, Irfan Mensur, Jelica Sretenović, Danica Maksimović, Nada Vojinović

Zaseda
programme.desc: Directed by Zivojin Pavlovic. With Milena Dravic, Ivica Vidovic, Severin Bijelic, Slobodan Aligrudic. programme.title: Poslednja trka
Posljednja trka
programme.desc: Poslednja trka: Directed by Jovan Rancic. With Vladimir Buljan, Mirjana Jokovic, Bogoljub Petrovic, Pavle Vuisic. Zoran, a twelve-year-old son of divorced parents, lives in a skyscraper, but the drab of urban living is somewhat improved by the proximity of a hippodrome and a horse farm. Zoran's favorite horse is a former champion named Zimzelen (Evergreen), a stud whom the administration decides to sell to the slaughterhouse. After an unsuccessful attempt to change their mind, Zoran and his friends steal the horse and disappear. programme.title: Zaseda
programme.desc: Ljudi se nakon Drugog svjetskog rata bore za obnovu zemlje. Mladić, Dalmatinac, kome su Italijani ubili oca, školuje se u Srbiji kod rođaka. Ljudi se nakon Drugog svjetskog rata bore za obnovu zemlje. Mladić, Dalmatinac, kome su Italijani ubili oca, školuje se u Srbiji kod rođaka. Svesrdno radi kao aktivist misleći da koristi višim ciljevima. Ne bi li se potpuno stavio u službu revolucije uključuje se u redove Ozne, ali kasnije razočaran zbog karijerizma pojedinaca, napušta službu. "Zabunom" gine od seoske milicije.

programme.title: Sveto mesto
Sveto mesto
programme.desc: Sveto mesto: Directed by Djordje Kadijevic. With Dragan Jovanovic, Branka Pujic, Aleksandar Bercek, Mira Banjac. Sveto mesto (A Holy Place, 1990) is based on a literary classic, Nikolai Gogol's 1835 short story, 'Viy'. However, Kadijevic uses it only as a starting point for his own explorations into the dark side of eroticism. Gogol's story deals with Toma, a reluctant theology student who is forced to read the Psalms over an (un)dead girl for three nights in a row. All the while supernatural forces are trying to grab him from the Holy Circle drawn on the church floor. Kadijevic adapts and enriches 'Viy' by inventing a new backstory for the witch-girl and her father. The dead girl, Catherine (unwittingly killed in the prologue, while in the shape of a hag), is referred to as a 'saint' and her father is a harsh and unpleasant man. Kadijevic departs further from the original story, and introduces an excess of perversity and horror more reminiscent of the Anglo-American gothic than the milder Slavic attempts in a similar mode. Incest is the name of the game here." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0181845/","name":"Sveto mesto","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmRjNmMxNGEtNWE4NC00YTEzLWIxOTctN2ZjMDU4YWQ3MzdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzAyMzY2NDk@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama","Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431259/","name":"Dragan Jovanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0700234/","name":"Branka Pujic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0073353/","name":"Aleksandar Bercek"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0434337/","name":"Djordje Kadijevic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053534/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076194/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0324690/","name":"Nikolay Gogol"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0434337/","name":"Djordje Kadijevic"}],"datePublished":"1990-09-29","description":"Sveto mesto (A Holy Place, 1990) is based on a literary classic, Nikolai Gogol's 1835 short story, 'Viy'. However, Kadijevic uses it only as a starting point for his own explorations into the dark side of eroticism. Gogol's story dea","keywords":"creepy,father,incest,church,foreign language adaptation","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0181845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"superbmov"},"dateCreated":"2016-01-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"The finest Balkan horror movie","reviewBody":"There are not that many horror movies from Balkan(ex yu)so this one is little gem... From the creator of the movie ..she butterfly'' comes this horror... It's based of Gogol's short story ,,viy'' but just with the set on different place... The movie has a dark tone and soundtrack that could been a better, but hey imagery may draw you back from watching this... This is example of a horror that is done without blood and its scary it mixes a folklore witch,demon and dark stories in one move its just great... Every thing that you have to expect here is Dark and it combines everything fine! It works and it is interesting to watch! Great tone,fitting imagery and OK soundtrack makes this film good!!! High recommendation!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":934,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Maratonci trče počasni krug
programme.desc: Directed by Slobodan Sijan. With Bogdan Diklic, Danilo 'Bata' Stojkovic, Pavle Vuisic, Mija Aleksic. The Topalovic family has been in the burial business for generations. When the old (150 yrs old) Pantelija dies, five generations of his heirs start to fight for the inheritance.

programme.title: Virdzina
Virdžina
programme.desc: Virdzina: Directed by Srdjan Karanovic. With Miodrag Krivokapic, Marta Keler, Inka Gogálová, Igor Bjelan. "Virgina" tells a tale from the end of the 19th century. It took place in a isolated village near the Adriatic Sea. Because of the extreme patriarchal culture there is a superstition that families without male heirs are cursed. When the wife of a farmer gives birth to their fourth daughter, father decides that the child will become a so-called "Virgina" and that she will live as a man, so that she can work and be the family heir. This heartbreaking story of Virgina's life is told with strong words, augmented with harsh environment." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105761/","name":"Virdzina","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODVmNDc3ZTUtZDk3Ny00MjJjLWE5ZjgtMjJjMTU1MzZmY2U4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0471771/","name":"Miodrag Krivokapic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445447/","name":"Marta Keler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0324632/","name":"Inka Gogálová"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438906/","name":"Srdjan Karanovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016788/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065791/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438906/","name":"Srdjan Karanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0547719/","name":"Milosav Marinovic"}],"datePublished":"1991-04-05","description":""Virgina" tells a tale from the end of the 19th century. It took place in a isolated village near the Adriatic Sea. Because of the extreme patriarchal culture there is a superstition that families without male heirs are cursed. When ","keywords":"superstition,village,farmer,sexual identity,gender confusion","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105761/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"itends-here"},"dateCreated":"2010-12-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amazing film","reviewBody":"The idea of this film is quite original and intriguing. I watched it for the first time about a year ago and I now consider it one of my favourite films of all time. As an English speaker, the Serbian dialogue/necessity of subtitles did not take anything from my enjoyment, as it added to the otherworldly, minimalistic atmosphere. After being flooded with Hollywood sensationalism, a film like this is extremely refreshing- dramatic but not melodramatic. It is honest and beautiful. The focus is on the internal and external struggles of the characters instead of action and visual effects. I found myself brought to tears by the plight of the protagonist; I would recommend this to anyone who likes foreign films, GLBT films (as it shows a different aspect of gender identity), or "slow", thoughtful dramas.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":482,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kakav deda takav unuk
Kakav deda takav unuk
programme.desc: Directed by Zoran Calic. With Dragomir Bojanic-Gidra, Rialda Kadric, Vladimir Petrovic, Jelena Zigon. Zika and Milan are fighting over who gets to spend more time with grandson Misha, who is five years old. Although Misha lives with his parents in Milan grandfather, Zika all ways of trying to learn Misa tavern life and his craft. A Milan his grandson sent to violin lessons and English. Come up with a number of interesting situations.

programme.title: Tajvanska kanasta
Tajvanska kanasta
programme.desc: Tajvanska kanasta: Directed by Goran Markovic. With Boris Komnenic, Neda Arneric, Radko Polic, Gordana Gadzic. A frustrated and unemployed architect experiences flashbacks of his youth and 1968 protests while the life passes by. After a shootout on a flight transporting prisoners, a flight attendant must outwit a smooth-talking serial killer and land the plane herself." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120390/","name":"Turbulence","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMxNGY4NWQtYjUxOC00ZWYwLWExZTYtNmEwODg5MzFmZmEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0NTI0Nw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000501/","name":"Ray Liotta"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000452/","name":"Lauren Holly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322407/","name":"Brendan Gleeson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125111/","name":"Robert Butler"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030480/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0107954/","name":"Jonathan Brett"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3820273689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTRiODM4NGQtY2Y1Ni00MzJlLThlMDAtNmE2ZTkyM2JjNzA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTRiODM4NGQtY2Y1Ni00MzJlLThlMDAtNmE2ZTkyM2JjNzA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a shootout on a flight transporting prisoners, a flight attendant must outwit a smooth-talking serial killer and land the plane herself."},"datePublished":"1997-01-10","description":"After a shootout on a flight transporting prisoners, a flight attendant must outwit a smooth-talking serial killer and land the plane herself.","keywords":"airplane,pilot,shootout,stewardess,fear","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120390/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ddd3"},"dateCreated":"2004-06-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Your life is too short...","reviewBody":"Don't watch this film. It will plant the idea that flight crew really

might be this stupid in your mind and make you afraid to fly. This is

one of those movies where no-one does anything sensible, from the

pilot, who, knowing that there are two violent criminals on board his

'plane, hears gunshots and goes out to see what's happening, to the

stewardess who's locked herself in the cabin because she KNOWS what's

going on, and then comes out because the bad guy tells her that her

friend is asking for her, despite the trifling fact that the cops, the

FBI, and the ground crew have all told her that her friend is probably

already dead, and they need her in the cabin to monitor what the

'plane's doing or everyone will be dead anyway. 

You will, however, be pleased to learn that, after being set alight,

flying into a casino and a parking garage, having a truck wedged on its

undercarriage, and being fired at by a fighter plane (Not to mention

the scene, right out of 'Airplane', where the 'plane flies upside down

for a while, entirely of its own volition...), the aeroplane itself

emerges unscathed. 

This isn't so bad that it's good, it's so bad that it should have been

strangled at birth, and I'm a pacifist by nature."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10948,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

Bobby James, are dispatched to North Korea on a covert mission, all in an effort to take out a missile site..." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0497329/","name":"Behind Enemy Lines II: Axis of Evil","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMxMTY4MjMyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0NjAwNzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0327764/","name":"Nicholas Gonzalez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1140952/","name":"Matt Bushell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0202966/","name":"Keith David"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230286/","name":"James Dodson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230286/","name":"James Dodson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Behind Enemy Lines 2: Axis of Evil","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3753443609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY3NTIyMzUtMDk1ZC00YmNiLTg2NTEtNTUxYWE4NTAwNmMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY3NTIyMzUtMDk1ZC00YmNiLTg2NTEtNTUxYWE4NTAwNmMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"2006-10-17","description":"Navy SEALS, headed by Lt. Bobby James, are dispatched to North Korea on a covert mission, all in an effort to take out a missile site...","keywords":"time bomb,navy,vietnam war veteran,the white house,president","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0497329/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"landriau2"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"America saved the world again !! still not that bad","reviewBody":"
* expect nothing while renting it , you may enjoy it .



* Not the same story as the first one , the guy is not lost and alone this time .



* lot of already seen before cliché - camera light while in north Korea make you think this country is lifeless and evil , yet the mountain and image are spectacular . but nothing new .



* the camera shake way too much ( as most of DTV movies ) , and some unnecessary background , camera effect make the movie hard to follow sometimes .



* slowdown action ( dtv cliché again ) - the plot has a lot of whole but still enjoyable , base on the 2004 event in north Korea ( making the plot more realistic about what wouold have happen ) still not that bad . i must say i enjoy it . the filming location were great and despite that the camera light was to give north Korea a lifeless look ...... the sight and mountain are great throughout the movie .



* ill give it a 5 or 6 out of 10 . but don't expect something new , a mixe of sum of all the fears , behind enemy line ( visual effect ) , tears of the sun etc... and other America saved the world movie . classic Hollywood cliché .


-in 1995-1996 ... "america saved the world" movies were meant to be "america saved the world " , but now .... they are trying to disguise it while the headline is still the same . assume it at least .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5464,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.5},"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

* expect nothing while renting it , you may enjoy it .



* Not the same story as the first one , the guy is not lost and alone this time .



* lot of already seen before cliché - camera light while in north Korea make you think this country is lifeless and evil , yet the mountain and image are spectacular . but nothing new .



* the camera shake way too much ( as most of DTV movies ) , and some unnecessary background , camera effect make the movie hard to follow sometimes .



* slowdown action ( dtv cliché again ) - the plot has a lot of whole but still enjoyable , base on the 2004 event in north Korea ( making the plot more realistic about what wouold have happen ) still not that bad . i must say i enjoy it . the filming location were great and despite that the camera light was to give north Korea a lifeless look ...... the sight and mountain are great throughout the movie .



* ill give it a 5 or 6 out of 10 . but don't expect something new , a mixe of sum of all the fears , behind enemy line ( visual effect ) , tears of the sun etc... and other America saved the world movie . classic Hollywood cliché .


-in 1995-1996 ... "america saved the world" movies were meant to be "america saved the world " , but now .... they are trying to disguise it while the headline is still the same . assume it at least .","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5464,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.5,"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

institution","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0259711/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vithiet"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"This was a weird thriller... but I liked it!","reviewBody":"I remember liking it when I saw it way back then and I enjoyed it again upon recent viewing. I never knew it was a remake and still haven't seen the original so I can't compare but Vanilla Sky on its own is a pretty solid movie. It is very strange in its pacing and cinematography but it didn't bother me or felt boring as these exercises in style often do. Great thriller with very good acting performances overall, and unhinged Tom Cruise was the perfect guy for this crazy role in this crazy movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":252640,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"duration":"PT2H16M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Marauders

programme.desc:
Marauders: Directed by Steven C. Miller. With Bruce Willis, Christopher Meloni, Dave Bautista, Adrian Grenier. When a bank is hit by a brutal heist, all evidence points to the owner and his high-powered clients. But as a group of FBI agents dig deeper into the case - and the deadly heists continue - it becomes clear that a larger conspiracy is at play." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3963816/","name":"Marauders","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU2OTc1OTgyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU4OTMxOTE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005221/","name":"Christopher Meloni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1176985/","name":"Dave Bautista"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1921345/","name":"Steven C. Miller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017712/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0327256/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0209560/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6710963/","name":"Michael Cody"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1032754/","name":"Chris Sivertson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Marauders","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi46184985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjExYzc5N2QtZmMyYS00ZWIyLThmMTEtNTRiZWJiMDE1ODA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjExYzc5N2QtZmMyYS00ZWIyLThmMTEtNTRiZWJiMDE1ODA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Marauders"},"datePublished":"2016-07-01","description":"When a bank is hit by a brutal heist, all evidence points to the owner and his high-powered clients. But as a group of FBI agents dig deeper into the case - and the deadly heists continue - it becomes clear that a larger conspiracy i","keywords":"shooting,stabbing,blood,spurting blood,blood on face","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3963816/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bcheng93"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"very good movie...but...it could've have been great...","reviewBody":"...don't understand where all the hate is coming from for this movie. you want to watch a bad and stupid action heist movie?...then watch "heist". "heist got almost a full star higher rating here on IMDb and i couldn't even finish it...it was that bad. ...i'm a fan of good movies...i watch independents and art-house movies more then the blockbusters. pus i've watched most of the black and white classics. i'm just a fan of good movies.

that's why i can't understand the hate from the reviewers here and thats why i voted it a 7 out of 10. it's more like a 6.5 tho.

this movie could've been great tho...instead of just very good...but all in all it had me riveted to the screen for its duration. my only gripe was the movie should've been over 2 hours so the nitpickers will shut up about how convoluted and not well told it was. movies require you to use your brain sometimes...this was one of them.

all in all a very good watch if you are an action movie fan and just a enjoyable watch. another big bonus for me which others didn't like as much...the constant rain in the movie. it rained thru-out the whole movie just about...yayyyy.

solid solid action thriller revenge style flick...an atrocity that this movie gets a rating of 5.4 here on IMDb while clunkers like "heist" gets a much higher rating.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Public Eye
Oko javnosti
programme.desc:
The Public Eye: Directed by Howard Franklin. With Joe Pesci, Richard Riehle, Bryan Travis Smith, Max Brooks. In the early 1940s, an infamous New York paparazzo gets an assignment from a club owner to do a background search on a mysterious gangster, which leads him down a very dangerous path." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105187/","name":"The Public Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTRiZWE1OGYtNmNhYy00MjgwLThmYjAtOTA4M2RkMWE3ZTU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000582/","name":"Joe Pesci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001347/","name":"Barbara Hershey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0726223/","name":"Richard Riehle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0291442/","name":"Howard Franklin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0291442/","name":"Howard Franklin"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Public Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3237478681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdkNWQ2OTctNjNmZi00NDllLTlkNWYtYmIxZTMwNDQ2ZTY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdkNWQ2OTctNjNmZi00NDllLTlkNWYtYmIxZTMwNDQ2ZTY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"text os"},"datePublished":"1992-10-16","description":"In the early 1940s, an infamous New York paparazzo gets an assignment from a club owner to do a background search on a mysterious gangster, which leads him down a very dangerous path.","keywords":"neo noir,taxi,darkroom,photographer,news photographer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105187/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"secondtake"},"dateCreated":"2011-10-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Some great mood and pseudo-noir stuff, and Pesci is terrific","reviewBody":"The Private Eye (1992)

This is a fictionalized story of the very real NYC crime photographer Weegee, and if you've seen pictures of Weegee or heard his story, Joe Pesci is the perfect cast for the role, coming right after "Goodfellas." He nails it, a terrific performance, even down to handling the cameras well.

Too bad the rest of the film is hit or miss. Maybe on the hit (good) side is the general set design and atmosphere. It feels like a slightly simplified and cleaned up 1942 Manhattan (where most or all of this occurs). And Barbara Hershey as the leading woman (not quite a femme fatale, it seems, but she has that look) is solid, especially with her hair up. You'll see, a good strong look. And the cameras are pretty right on (I'm a photographer, and I shoot with one of these 4x5 Graflex press cameras all the time), though at a glance it seemed that at least one of his Graflexes was a post-war model. We'll let that slip. And on the plus side it has to be said that Mark Isham's last minute hiring for the score was inspired, because it gives the movie the depth it needs.

The misses on the film are deeply integral to enjoying it all the way--the plot, the secondary actors, the direction. The latter is hard to pin down within the obvious and almost purposely clichéd plot, but you feel all along that the movie is put together functionally, as if the director knows most of all that these pieces have to go in order. But giving it flow, elegance, power, and even a convincing mise-en-scene is not just a matter of logic. It feels off, as it out of tune. It's especially noticeable because so much of the film is going right, including Pesci.

There is the question of why did they take Weegee (a.k.a. Arthur Fellig) and turn him into Bernzini (a.k.a. Leon Bernstein)--apparently it was a rights issue with the original story, but certainly the new story could have still been based on Weegee. The images in the film look like pseudo-Weegee moments as much as Pesci looks like Weegee, and Wikipedia says that some of these are actual Weegees. (I have my doubts, but who knows?) Both men had outrageous rubber stamps for the back of their prints that are almost identical--Weegee's said "Weegee the Great." The car is identical, for sure, and even the pace and the world are Weegee's.

Beyond all of this, the movie is entertaining if never commanding, and quite beautifully photographed--I'm talking the cinematography, now. My copy was VHS, and it doesn't sound like the DVD service through Amazon called the Universal Vault Series has very high standards (one user said it looked like VHS quality). I would think a full widescreen version would be worth the trouble--maybe try an Amazon instant play for $3. This says specifically that it is widescreen."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3515,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: Korporativna stručnjakinja za rješavanje problema (Kate Mara) poslana je na udaljenu, strogo skrivanu lokaciju, gdje treba istražiti i procijeniti zastrašujuću nesreću. Ona saznaje da je događaj... Korporativna stručnjakinja za rješavanje problema (Kate Mara) poslana je na udaljenu, strogo skrivanu lokaciju, gdje treba istražiti i procijeniti zastrašujuću nesreću. Ona saznaje da je događaj izazvalo naizgled nedužno "ljudsko biće" koje predstavlja tajnu od beskrajnog potencijala i neprocjenjive opasnosti. Ta je tajna Morgan, sljedeći korak u ljudskoj evoluciji i biomedicinsko biće sa sintetskim DNK-om. U dobi od jednog mjeseca, ona (ono) je hodala i razgovarala, a za šest je mjeseci nadmašila najluđa očekivanja svojih tvoraca. Morgan je zagonetna i nepredvidljiva laboratorijski stvoreno biće s emocionalnim sposobnostima i suprotstavljenim osobinama koje zamagljuju liniju između ljudskog i sintetičkog. Ali što se događa kada stvorenje nadmaši stvoritelja? I što je opasnije ovo genetski modificirano čudo ili korporacija koja nadgleda njegov razvoj?

credits.actor: Maria Olsen, Paulie Rojas Redding, Nancy Wolfe, Michael St. Michaels, David Landry, Lillian Pennypacker

technology","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2316204/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jonpaul-stone-895-772059"},"dateCreated":"2017-05-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Still waiting for answers, but mostly left with more questions","reviewBody":"Alien: Covenant was a good quintessential Alien movie. If you were looking for answers and an explanation of what happened after Prometheus; only expect, beyond the obvious, a few vague ones. Without revealing any major plot points, if you have watched the Prologues released by Fox, I can say that not much more than what have already been seen there is shown. The brief "add on" to the prologue, stitched into the movie as a flash back, does explain (sorta) exactly what happened after Shaw and David arrived at the Engineer Home World, but only in a very vaguely and briefly, leaving a lot unanswered. Including what happened to Shaw. There is a few tidbits that make it clear she was there, and vague explanation (sorta) of what may have became of her.

I was hoping to leave the theater saying I get it, it all makes sense, and I think you do kinda get that, but not really. Many more questions are left then answers given. Like Chinese food; really good and you eat a lot but, your still hungry and still not fully satisfied when you leave the restaurant. A bit disappointing especially with a run time just over 2 hours. They packed in a lot of what Alien is known for, but it got a bit too esoteric and even a bit boring at times.

We do get to start seeing how the Covenant mission is getting closer in the Alien Cannon time frame to the Nostromo encounter. Also, little tidbits that any fan of the original Alien will pick up on and appreciate. Absolutely go see this movie, but expect to be left hungry and wanting more. 7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":260172,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The X Files: I Want to Believe
Dosije X Želim da verujem
programme.desc: The X Files: I Want to Believe: Directed by Chris Carter. With David Duchovny, Gillian Anderson, Amanda Peet, Billy Connolly. Mulder and Scully are called back to duty by the FBI when a former priest claims to be receiving psychic visions pertaining to a kidnapped agent." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0443701/","name":"The X Files: I Want to Believe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk5MThhOTQtZTY5OC00MzgwLWE4MTctNTI4OGEwNjU3YTZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000141/","name":"David Duchovny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000096/","name":"Gillian Anderson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175262/","name":"Billy Connolly"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004810/","name":"Chris Carter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078377/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0241738/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0819487/","name":"Frank Spotnitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004810/","name":"Chris Carter"}],"datePublished":"2008-08-06","description":"Mulder and Scully are called back to duty by the FBI when a former priest claims to be receiving psychic visions pertaining to a kidnapped agent.","keywords":"x files,fbi federal bureau of investigation,psychic vision,psychic,priest","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0443701/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"reidy-christopher"},"dateCreated":"2008-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Thing With Two Brains That Wouldn't Die","reviewBody":"I was pleasantly surprised when I saw a trailer for this movie a while back. I always enjoyed the show when I caught it on TV, except when it got really stupid towards the end (Mulder dies, then is buried in a coffin and is then dug up again and is alive--Excuse me?). Given that, I was happy to catch up with Scully and Mulder. It had been six years. Six years. Six years for the shows creators to come up with a script worthy of the legacy of the show. NOT! What a piece of doo-doo. This wouldn't have cut it as a two part episode during season eight. What were they thinking? That show had some of the best writing and directing in the history of television. Part of the joy of watching that show was that it was so much like a movie. Every week you got to watch an incredibly engrossing mini-movie. I felt bad for the actors. They looked slightly embarrassed to be there. Imagine having read the script, knowing it was a dog, and then having to do it and not be able to tell the writer, "You know, Chris, this really sucks..." because he's the big honcho and gave you your big break seventeen years ago. This is supposed to be a movie. Movies are supposed to be BIG. This seemed chintzy. It felt like a rip-off. Six years! If they weren't going to do it right, why did they do it at all? During the movie, my friend, who is not really a big fan of X-Files, leaned over and said, "This is like a remake of "Plan 9 From Outer Space" with an actual budget..." Sadly, I had to agree."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":89283,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

No, Picard se suočava sa zapovijedi da zanemari taj propis. Ako posluša, spasiti će milijune Ba'kua. Ako ne posluša, riskirati će bord, karijeru i život. No, za Picarda postoji samo jedan izbor.

programme.title: The X Files: I Want to Believe
Dosije X Želim da verujem
programme.desc: The X Files: I Want to Believe: Directed by Chris Carter. With David Duchovny, Gillian Anderson, Amanda Peet, Billy Connolly. Mulder and Scully are called back to duty by the FBI when a former priest claims to be receiving psychic visions pertaining to a kidnapped agent." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0443701/","name":"The X Files: I Want to Believe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk5MThhOTQtZTY5OC00MzgwLWE4MTctNTI4OGEwNjU3YTZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000141/","name":"David Duchovny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000096/","name":"Gillian Anderson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0175262/","name":"Billy Connolly"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004810/","name":"Chris Carter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078377/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0241738/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0819487/","name":"Frank Spotnitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004810/","name":"Chris Carter"}],"datePublished":"2008-08-06","description":"Mulder and Scully are called back to duty by the FBI when a former priest claims to be receiving psychic visions pertaining to a kidnapped agent.","keywords":"x files,fbi federal bureau of investigation,psychic vision,psychic,priest","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0443701/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"reidy-christopher"},"dateCreated":"2008-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Thing With Two Brains That Wouldn't Die","reviewBody":"I was pleasantly surprised when I saw a trailer for this movie a while back. I always enjoyed the show when I caught it on TV, except when it got really stupid towards the end (Mulder dies, then is buried in a coffin and is then dug up again and is alive--Excuse me?). Given that, I was happy to catch up with Scully and Mulder. It had been six years. Six years. Six years for the shows creators to come up with a script worthy of the legacy of the show. NOT! What a piece of doo-doo. This wouldn't have cut it as a two part episode during season eight. What were they thinking? That show had some of the best writing and directing in the history of television. Part of the joy of watching that show was that it was so much like a movie. Every week you got to watch an incredibly engrossing mini-movie. I felt bad for the actors. They looked slightly embarrassed to be there. Imagine having read the script, knowing it was a dog, and then having to do it and not be able to tell the writer, "You know, Chris, this really sucks..." because he's the big honcho and gave you your big break seventeen years ago. This is supposed to be a movie. Movies are supposed to be BIG. This seemed chintzy. It felt like a rip-off. Six years! If they weren't going to do it right, why did they do it at all? During the movie, my friend, who is not really a big fan of X-Files, leaned over and said, "This is like a remake of "Plan 9 From Outer Space" with an actual budget..." Sadly, I had to agree."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":89283,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

attempt a harrowing escape.","keywords":"xenomorph,android,alien,future,alien technology","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2316204/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jonpaul-stone-895-772059"},"dateCreated":"2017-05-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Still waiting for answers, but mostly left with more questions","reviewBody":"Alien: Covenant was a good quintessential Alien movie. If you were looking for answers and an explanation of what happened after Prometheus; only expect, beyond the obvious, a few vague ones. Without revealing any major plot points, if you have watched the Prologues released by Fox, I can say that not much more than what have already been seen there is shown. The brief "add on" to the prologue, stitched into the movie as a flash back, does explain (sorta) exactly what happened after Shaw and David arrived at the Engineer Home World, but only in a very vaguely and briefly, leaving a lot unanswered. Including what happened to Shaw. There is a few tidbits that make it clear she was there, and vague explanation (sorta) of what may have became of her.

I was hoping to leave the theater saying I get it, it all makes sense, and I think you do kinda get that, but not really. Many more questions are left then answers given. Like Chinese food; really good and you eat a lot but, your still hungry and still not fully satisfied when you leave the restaurant. A bit disappointing especially with a run time just over 2 hours. They packed in a lot of what Alien is known for, but it got a bit too esoteric and even a bit boring at times.

We do get to start seeing how the Covenant mission is getting closer in the Alien Cannon time frame to the Nostromo encounter. Also, little tidbits that any fan of the original Alien will pick up on and appreciate. Absolutely go see this movie, but expect to be left hungry and wanting more. 7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":260172,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="
