programme.title: Seventh Son
Sedmi Sin
programme.desc:
Seventh Son: Directed by Sergei Bodrov. With Jeff Bridges, Ben Barnes, Julianne Moore, Alicia Vikander. When Mother Malkin, the queen of evil witches, escapes the pit she was imprisoned in by professional monster hunter Spook decades ago and kills his apprentice, he recruits young Tom, the seventh son of the seventh son, to help him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1121096/","name":"Seventh Son","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNTg2MDkyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA3NzY1MjE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1602660/","name":"Ben Barnes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000313/","name":"Jeff Bridges"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0091076/","name":"Sergei Bodrov"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0494795/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049799/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0495378/","name":"Charles Leavitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1140275/","name":"Steven Knight"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0338557/","name":"Matt Greenberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1803464473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAyMjkxMzQ3MTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDk2NzM3NDMx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAyMjkxMzQ3MTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDk2NzM3NDMx._V1_.jpg","description":"John Gregory, who is a seventh son of a seventh son and also the local spook, has protected he country from witches, boggarts, ghouls and all manner of things that go bump in the night. However John is not young anymore, and has been seeking an apprentice to carry on his trade. Most have failed to survive. The last hope is a young farmer's son named Thomas Ward. Will he survive the training to become the spook that so many others couldn't? Should he trust the girl with pointy shoes? How can Thomas stand a chance against Mother Malkin, the most dangerous witch in the county?
"},"datePublished":"2015-01-16","description":"When Mother Malkin, the queen of evil witches, escapes the pit she was imprisoned in by professional monster hunter Spook decades ago and kills his apprentice, he recruits young Tom, the seventh son of the seventh son, to help him.","keywords":"witch,sword and fantasy,sword and sorcery,apprentice,magic","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1121096/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shawneofthedead"},"dateCreated":"2015-01-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Neither a disaster nor a classic, but decent, fun and action-packed in its own right.","reviewBody":"It isn't easy to make a good fantasy film – as borne out by Seventh Son, which has suffered a particularly arduous journey to the silver screen. Originally slated for release in February 2013, its visual effects house went bankrupt and its studio, Legendary Pictures, parted ways with distributor Warner Bros. The film that's finally stumbling into cinemas almost two full years later (courtesy of Universal Pictures) should be an unmitigated disaster. Surprisingly, it's not. The film isn't exactly great, but it's a largely entertaining romp that's more inspired by than strictly faithful to Joseph Delaney's series of bestselling books.

Tom Ward (Ben Barnes) is the seventh son of a seventh son: a rare genetic lineage that sets him on the path to becoming a Spook a.k.a., a slayer of the myriad evil creatures that haunt the land. He becomes the apprentice of grizzled, alcohol-addled John Gregory (Jeff Bridges), shortly after Mother Malkin (Julianne Moore), an evil witch, escapes her earthly prison to claim the world as her own. With only a week to go before the blood moon rises, Tom trains with Gregory but finds himself distracted by the charms of Alice (Alicia Vikander) – a mysterious young lady with a few secrets of her own.

While hardly groundbreaking in any way, the story unfolds with unexpected punch. Tom's story – one in which he comes of age and comes into his own – is accompanied by plenty of action sequences, courtesy of bone-crunching battles between men and other men (and women) who turn into soaring, swooping, fire-breathing dragons. Tom tumbles over a cliff to avoid a pursuing monster, Gregory battles a gigantic bear, and wraiths of smoke and despair trail after the Spook and his apprentice as they make their way through a dark, brooding forest.

It helps, too, that the film is leavened by a welcome bite of humour. Seventh Son doesn't take itself as deadly seriously as some of its brethren in the fantasy genre do. That's why Gregory plunges into a bar brawl armed with nothing more than his flagon of beer, and Tom is allowed to make quite a few cutting remarks about his purported mentor that are heartily returned with interest.

Ardent fans of Delaney's books should be warned: Seventh Son riffs on elements of the novels rather than staying strictly true to them. For one thing, Tom is considerably older in the film. Most noticeably, Malkin is a very different character than she is on the page. She's given more depth and complexity here, her vile behaviour explained, if not strictly justified by, her past entanglements with Gregory. It's actually quite nice to see a fantasy world that doesn't simply perpetuate the trope of the wicked witch, but instead dreams up characters that fall along a broad spectrum of morality.

Barnes is well-cast as Tom, holding his own as both a hero and quasi-romantic lead. He shares a sweet, though not particularly electric, chemistry with Vikander who is, thankfully, called upon to do more than simper and flirt. But there are considerably more thrills to be had with Bridges, who manages to fold charm, menace and darkness into Gregory; and Moore, who's clearly having plenty of fun cutting her way through scenes as a whirlwind of madness and malevolence.

By all accounts, Seventh Son should really have been an outright flop. It may still play as such to any fantasy aficionados who are demanding greatness on the level of The Lord Of The Rings. But, for pretty much everyone else, Seventh Son is an entertaining, undemanding film with some good ideas and a lot of fun moments. It's not a particularly great example of its genre but, given its troubled production history, that it's not completely execrable is probably nothing short of a miracle.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":73367,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1121096, Title: Seventh Son, --- Description: Seventh Son: Directed by Sergei Bodrov. With Jeff Bridges, Ben Barnes, Julianne Moore, Alicia Vikander. When Mother Malkin, the queen of evil witches, escapes the pit she was imprisoned in by professional monster hunter Spook decades ago and kills his apprentice, he recruits young Tom, the seventh son of the seventh son, to help him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1121096/","name":"Seventh Son","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNTg2MDkyN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA3NzY1MjE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1602660/","name":"Ben Barnes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000313/","name":"Jeff Bridges"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0091076/","name":"Sergei Bodrov"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0494795/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049799/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0159111/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0495378/","name":"Charles Leavitt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1140275/","name":"Steven Knight","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0338557/","name":"Matt Greenberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1803464473","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAyMjkxMzQ3MTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDk2NzM3NDMx._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAyMjkxMzQ3MTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDk2NzM3NDMx._V1_.jpg","description":"John Gregory, who is a seventh son of a seventh son and also the local spook, has protected he country from witches, boggarts, ghouls and all manner of things that go bump in the night. However John is not young anymore, and has been seeking an apprentice to carry on his trade. Most have failed to survive. The last hope is a young farmer's son named Thomas Ward. Will he survive the training to become the spook that so many others couldn't? Should he trust the girl with pointy shoes? How can Thomas stand a chance against Mother Malkin, the most dangerous witch in the county?
","datePublished":"2015-01-16","description":"When Mother Malkin, the queen of evil witches, escapes the pit she was imprisoned in by professional monster hunter Spook decades ago and kills his apprentice, he recruits young Tom, the seventh son of the seventh son, to help him.","keywords":"witch,sword and fantasy,sword and sorcery,apprentice,magic","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1121096/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shawneofthedead","dateCreated":"2015-01-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Neither a disaster nor a classic, but decent, fun and action-packed in its own right.","reviewBody":"It isn't easy to make a good fantasy film – as borne out by Seventh Son, which has suffered a particularly arduous journey to the silver screen. Originally slated for release in February 2013, its visual effects house went bankrupt and its studio, Legendary Pictures, parted ways with distributor Warner Bros. The film that's finally stumbling into cinemas almost two full years later (courtesy of Universal Pictures) should be an unmitigated disaster. Surprisingly, it's not. The film isn't exactly great, but it's a largely entertaining romp that's more inspired by than strictly faithful to Joseph Delaney's series of bestselling books.

Tom Ward (Ben Barnes) is the seventh son of a seventh son: a rare genetic lineage that sets him on the path to becoming a Spook a.k.a., a slayer of the myriad evil creatures that haunt the land. He becomes the apprentice of grizzled, alcohol-addled John Gregory (Jeff Bridges), shortly after Mother Malkin (Julianne Moore), an evil witch, escapes her earthly prison to claim the world as her own. With only a week to go before the blood moon rises, Tom trains with Gregory but finds himself distracted by the charms of Alice (Alicia Vikander) – a mysterious young lady with a few secrets of her own.

While hardly groundbreaking in any way, the story unfolds with unexpected punch. Tom's story – one in which he comes of age and comes into his own – is accompanied by plenty of action sequences, courtesy of bone-crunching battles between men and other men (and women) who turn into soaring, swooping, fire-breathing dragons. Tom tumbles over a cliff to avoid a pursuing monster, Gregory battles a gigantic bear, and wraiths of smoke and despair trail after the Spook and his apprentice as they make their way through a dark, brooding forest.

It helps, too, that the film is leavened by a welcome bite of humour. Seventh Son doesn't take itself as deadly seriously as some of its brethren in the fantasy genre do. That's why Gregory plunges into a bar brawl armed with nothing more than his flagon of beer, and Tom is allowed to make quite a few cutting remarks about his purported mentor that are heartily returned with interest.

Ardent fans of Delaney's books should be warned: Seventh Son riffs on elements of the novels rather than staying strictly true to them. For one thing, Tom is considerably older in the film. Most noticeably, Malkin is a very different character than she is on the page. She's given more depth and complexity here, her vile behaviour explained, if not strictly justified by, her past entanglements with Gregory. It's actually quite nice to see a fantasy world that doesn't simply perpetuate the trope of the wicked witch, but instead dreams up characters that fall along a broad spectrum of morality.

Barnes is well-cast as Tom, holding his own as both a hero and quasi-romantic lead. He shares a sweet, though not particularly electric, chemistry with Vikander who is, thankfully, called upon to do more than simper and flirt. But there are considerably more thrills to be had with Bridges, who manages to fold charm, menace and darkness into Gregory; and Moore, who's clearly having plenty of fun cutting her way through scenes as a whirlwind of madness and malevolence.

By all accounts, Seventh Son should really have been an outright flop. It may still play as such to any fantasy aficionados who are demanding greatness on the level of The Lord Of The Rings. But, for pretty much everyone else, Seventh Son is an entertaining, undemanding film with some good ideas and a lot of fun moments. It's not a particularly great example of its genre but, given its troubled production history, that it's not completely execrable is probably nothing short of a miracle.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":73367,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5,"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
The Running Man: Directed by Paul Michael Glaser. With Arnold Schwarzenegger, Maria Conchita Alonso, Yaphet Kotto, Jim Brown. In a dystopian America, a falsely convicted policeman gets his shot at freedom when he must forcibly participate in a TV game show where convicts, runners, must battle killers for their freedom." freedom.","keywords":"game of death,oppression,chainsaw,explosive collar,film starts with text","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093894/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"King_Opossum"},"dateCreated":"2000-04-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"A rollercoaster of a movie - great fun","reviewBody":"Released just as Arnold Schwarzenegger was achieving megastar status, this film about stardom is a wry pun on his career and the media business around him. Films like these are not meant to be analysed, they are meant to be enjoyed, and THE RUNNING MAN certainly manages to do that.

After a shaky start involving the worst title sequence in the history of cinema (although it's good to see the Sinclair Spectrum finally get global use!), director Paul Michael Glaser presents an eye-popping glimpse at the television of tomorrow. This witty slice of sociological irony would have admittedly been slicker in the hands of regular Paul Verhoeven, but Glaser keeps the action flowing throughout, and presents us with some bizarrely fascinating villains as well as the usual action frolics. One query, though, is over the level of violence. Oddly enough there doesn't really seem to be enough. In a program where the broad concept is horrifically barbaric, Glaser seems reluctant to horrify us beyond the disappointing "see the blood spattering from the violence that's just off camera" and those awful rubber corpses! I do not wish to appear to be encouraging unnecessary violence, but in a comic-book film where 'gore is its core', not including it almost makes you feel that it is trying to take itself too seriously, and therefore makes it even more horrific. Perhaps this delicate subject is better explained by Paul Verhoeven in his excellent commentary to ROBOCOP (DVD Criterion Collection).

But the performances in THE RUNNING MAN are suitably solid, from the powerful Schwarzenegger to the sleazy game show host. Any fan of the 80s action genre will love this, so sit back and prepare for SHOWTIME!!!!!!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":143830,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zvjezdane staze: Nemesis
programme.desc: Posada svemirskog broda Enterprise-E prisiljena je suočiti se s prijetnjom Ujedinjenoj Federaciji Planeta koju predstavlja remanski klon kapetana Picarda zvan Shinzon. Posada svemirskog broda Enterprise-E prisiljena je suočiti se s prijetnjom Ujedinjenoj Federaciji Planeta koju predstavlja remanski klon kapetana Picarda zvan Shinzon koji je državnim udarom preuzeo kontrolu nad Romulanskim Carstvom.Kapetan Jean-Luc Picard i njegova posada vraćaju se u borbu s novim zastrašujućim protivnikom... Koji slučajno ima šokantnu sličnost s Picardom! Nakon radosnog vjenčanja Williama Rikera i Deanne Troi Picard dobije još jedan razlog za slavlje: Romulanci žele mir, a kapetan će biti izaslanik Federacije. No dok Enterprise putuje prema Romulu, ondje ih očekuje genijalni zlikovac koji skriva pakleni plan uništenja te nezamislivu tajnu koja će Picardu pružiti najstrašniji izazov. Shinzon, remanski klon Picarda, želi ni manje ni više nego pokoriti Romulansko Carstvo, potpuno razoriti Zemlju te usmrtiti kapetana Picarda.

OK but could have been so much more","reviewBody":"It was a pretty interesting idea, but some core aspects about a horror film were done very poorly in this one, particularly pacing. it felt too fast and when you watch the film you'll see what I mean. There is minimal exposition (which is key to building character development and the characters are 1 dimensional. It was sufficiently gory and had a freaky villain but the twist at the end didn't really match the person of the killer. The film has some great atmosphere too used jumpscares quite a bit.\n\nIt could have been so much more but it would have had to fix all these issues, particularly pacing and characters","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":19744,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.8},"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Devil Inside

programme.desc:
The Devil Inside: Directed by William Brent Bell. With Fernanda Andrade, Simon Quarterman, Evan Helmuth, Ionut Grama. In Italy, a woman becomes involved in a series of unauthorized exorcisms during her mission to discover what happened to her mother, who allegedly murdered three people during her own exorcism." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1560985/","name":"The Devil Inside","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwOTg1MTk0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTA5NTI5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1223326/","name":"Fernanda Andrade"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0702945/","name":"Simon Quarterman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1069312/","name":"Evan Helmuth"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068587/","name":"William Brent Bell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0306248/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0342976/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0203017/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068587/","name":"William Brent Bell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1834343/","name":"Matthew Peterman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Devil Inside","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1191026201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY4NzAyOTMzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjg3MTQzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY4NzAyOTMzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjg3MTQzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman becomes involved in a series of unauthorized exorcisms during her mission to discover what happened to her mother, who allegedly murdered three people during her own exorcism. "},"datePublished":"2012-02-01","description":"In Italy, a woman becomes involved in a series of unauthorized exorcisms during her mission to discover what happened to her mother, who allegedly murdered three people during her own exorcism.","keywords":"found footage,exorcism,exorcist,demonic possession,no ending","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1560985/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"zard-man"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Laughing all the way to the bank.","reviewBody":"Before saying anything, let me point out I watch all films with an open mind, and normally I can enjoy a film regardless of how technically poor it is.

This however, was a farce. I honestly can't believe this film got released into theatres, scene after scene was a regurgitation of scenes that we've all seen before. Not just individual scenes, but the whole tone of the film was so familiar and dull.

I didn't take count, but after a noticeable amount of times of the date being shot at me with a low dong was laughable, the bloke who made it must've watched paranormal activity and thought "ooh that was good, I'll have that... then I'll grossly over use it" There was nothing new about any of the exorcism scenes, apart from it was with a hand held camera.. wow. just watch the exorcist and shake the TV around.

I felt like i was watching an awful, pretentious student film from the outset and most of the acting had me cringing in my seat. I literally have never seen a worse all round acting display in my life... it was just totally unacceptable. They were trying so hard to make it look 'real' or 'genuine' and it just looked pathetic, so many face head scratching and little smirks to themselves.

I won't go into the ending... but it summed the movie up really. unoriginal, contrived and no shock factor (which was obviously intended) you know when a film is so bad its kind of entertaining? well this is just offensive. It was shameful. I can't think of one redeeming quality.

I didn't take count, but after a noticeable amount of times of the date being shot at me with a low dong was laughable, the bloke who made it must've watched paranormal activity and thought "ooh that was good, I'll have that... then I'll grossly over use it" There was nothing new about any of the exorcism scenes, apart from it was with a hand held camera.. wow. just watch the exorcist and shake the TV around.

Rose","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4193321241","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWJhYTg0NjYtN2E2ZS00MmExLTk3ZGYtYjVlMGQ5YzU1NzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWJhYTg0NjYtN2E2ZS00MmExLTk3ZGYtYjVlMGQ5YzU1NzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"2005-12-07","description":"A lawyer takes on a negligent homicide case involving a priest who performed an exorcism on a young girl.","keywords":"supernatural horror,faith,christianity,reference to the virgin mary,demonic possession","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0404032/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Potty-Man"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent on so many levels; a lesson in mainstream film-making","reviewBody":"Wonderful, wonderful movie. A lesson in film-making. I know a lot of people won't be able to see it for what it is because of the supernatural/horror elements (which are usually a turn-off for film snobs), but the movie is just extremely well-made.

Consider the fact that Linney's character's true conflict is not winning the trial, but a satisfyingly complex internal struggle which I will not name so as not to spoil the movie. Or the plethora of food for thought that the movie offers, regarding existentialist issues of perception vs. objective truth, and social issues of liability and responsibility.

Some very interesting scenes that find ways to express things in subtle and creative ways without spelling them out. And an incredible and ballsy performance by Jennifer Carpenter, which takes Linda Blair's possession to a whole new level. Also, notice how a key dramatic monologue is presented, contrary to what we might expect, with no sentimental music in the background. The cinematography is also great. I was reminded of Dario Argento's vivid colors in Suspiria on more than one occasion.

Although it's not the focus of the film, the movie also offers a few very cool scare moments, and seeing Emily possessed is terrifying.

This is my favorite "underdog" movie of the year so far.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":121865,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

With Laura Linney, Tom Wilkinson, Campbell Scott, Jennifer Carpenter. A lawyer takes on a negligent homicide case involving a priest who performed an exorcism on a young girl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0404032/","name":"The Exorcism of Emily Rose","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI2NTM5MjQ0Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDAxNjAzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Thriller"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001473/","name":"Laura Linney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0013037/","name":"Shohreh Aghdashloo"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0220600/","name":"Scott Derrickson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005323/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0081526/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0090199/","name":"Paul Harris Boardman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0220600/","name":"Scott Derrickson"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Exorcism of Emily Rose","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4193321241","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWJhYTg0NjYtN2E2ZS00MmExLTk3ZGYtYjVlMGQ5YzU1NzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWJhYTg0NjYtN2E2ZS00MmExLTk3ZGYtYjVlMGQ5YzU1NzU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment","datePublished":"2005-12-07","description":"A lawyer takes on a negligent homicide case involving a priest who performed an exorcism on a young girl.","keywords":"supernatural horror,faith,christianity,reference to the virgin mary,demonic possession","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0404032/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Potty-Man","dateCreated":"2005-09-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent on so many levels; a lesson in mainstream film-making","reviewBody":"Wonderful, wonderful movie. A lesson in film-making. I know a lot of people won't be able to see it for what it is because of the supernatural/horror elements (which are usually a turn-off for film snobs), but the movie is just extremely well-made.

Consider the fact that Linney's character's true conflict is not winning the trial, but a satisfyingly complex internal struggle which I will not name so as not to spoil the movie. Or the plethora of food for thought that the movie offers, regarding existentialist issues of perception vs. objective truth, and social issues of liability and responsibility.

Some very interesting scenes that find ways to express things in subtle and creative ways without spelling them out. And an incredible and ballsy performance by Jennifer Carpenter, which takes Linda Blair's possession to a whole new level. Also, notice how a key dramatic monologue is presented, contrary to what we might expect, with no sentimental music in the background. The cinematography is also great. I was reminded of Dario Argento's vivid colors in Suspiria on more than one occasion.

Although it's not the focus of the film, the movie also offers a few very cool scare moments, and seeing Emily possessed is terrifying.

This is my favorite "underdog" movie of the year so far.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":121865,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"duration":"PT1H59M"</script><metacontent="

credits.actor: Amy Manson, Bradley Taylor, Claire Lams, Ovidiu Niculescu, Rob Freeman

programme.title: I dalje radimo non stop
programme.desc: David Jason ponovo je trgovac Grenvile, koji je nasledio mali dućan od voljenog, ali škrtog ujaka Arkvrajta. Grenvile sada vodi dućan zajedno sa svojim veselim i zgodnim sinom Lirojem, koji se rodio... David Jason ponovo je trgovac Grenvile, koji je nasledio mali dućan od voljenog, ali škrtog ujaka Arkvrajta. Grenvile sada vodi dućan zajedno sa svojim veselim i zgodnim sinom Lirojem, koji se rodio iz kratkog ljubavnog susreta od pre dvadesetak godina. Grenvile je i dalje na usluzi zajednici na svoj neponovljivi način. Željan zarade, Grenvile smišlja razne nepromišljene planove za podsticanje kupaca da ostave što više novca, ali retko kad postiže očekivane rezultate. Liroju ne nedostaje ženske pažnje, a Grenvilovo udvaranje staroj ljubavi Mavis stalno ometa njena žestoko zaštitnička sestra Madž. Tu je i uvek prisutna Crna Udovica, koja je takođe bacila oko na Grenvila, čini se.

programme.title: Škorpija
programme.desc: Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine:... Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine: Tobi Kurtis (Eddie Kaye Thomas), fini bihevioralista; Hapi Kin (Jadyn Wong) vunderkind za mehaniku i Silvester Dod (Ari Stidham), odličan statističar. Iako se međusobno odlično razumiju, vanjski svijet je za njih zagonetka. Srećom, Pejdž Dinin (Katharine McPhee) ima mladog sina koji će ih "prevesti" u vanjski svijet. Svi pobjeđuju s ovim timom: svojom izuzetnom domišljatošću rješavaju nacionalne krize, pomažući sebi da se uklope u stvarni svijet.

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Emmit Stussy, "kralj parkirališta Minnesote", zgodan je, samoostvareni mogul nekretnina sa savršenom porodicom, prava američka priča o uspjehu. Emmit Stussy, "kralj parkirališta Minnesote", zgodan je, samoostvareni mogul nekretnina sa savršenom porodicom, prava američka priča o uspjehu. Ray je više upozoravajuća priča. Umoran od života u Emmitovoj sjeni, Ray je proćelav, debeljuškast socijalni radnik koji je silno ogorčen kartama koje su mu podijeljene, a za to okrivljuje brata. Njihovo bratsko suparništvo vodi ih na krivi put koji počinje sitnim krađama, ali ubrzo dovodi do ubistava, mafijaša i surovog natjecateljskog bridža. Sitno suparništvo između dvojice braće eskalira i donosi haos maloj minesotskoj zajednici.

programme.title: Sajnfeld
programme.desc: Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet... Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet Emija, tri Zlatna globusa i pregršt drugih nagrada, čiji je broj mali u odnosu na višemilionski auditorijum koji je svake nedelje sedeo pred televizijskih ekrana kako bi video šta to njemu večeras na tako smešan i komičan način, smeta. Džeri je komičar koji ima najboljeg prijatelja, bivšu devojku koja mu postaje najbolja prijateljica i komšiju koji mu postaje deo života. Itekako mu ide sa ženama, ali nijedna mu ne odgovara: ili ima veliki nos, ili je prelepa, ali ne baš pod svakim svetlom itd...ali vremenom mu sve to postaje dosadno i odluči da menja svoj život.

credits.actor: Denis Leary, Michael Lombardi, Steven Pasquale, Andrea Roth, John Scurti, Daniel Sunjata, Callie Thorne, Natalie Distler

programme.title: Damages

programme.desc: Damages: Created by Glenn Kessler, Todd A. Kessler, Daniel Zelman. With Glenn Close, Rose Byrne, Tate Donovan, Zachary Booth. A law school graduate becomes the protégée of a successful high-stakes litigator." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0914387/","name":"Damages","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTM5NzkyYWEtNzU4Ni00MTViLTg5ZjAtMmFkNDNjYjBjYzc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTA4NzY1MzY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000335/","name":"Glenn Close"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0126284/","name":"Rose Byrne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004883/","name":"Tate Donovan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0236996/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0216537/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086397/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0450331/","name":"Glenn Kessler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0450393/","name":"Todd A. Kessler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0954664/","name":"Daniel Zelman"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Damages: The Complete First Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1369440537","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY4MTM0M2QtOGE2MS00NTFlLThkOWYtM2Q1Mzk1YzJlM2U5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY4MTM0M2QtOGE2MS00NTFlLThkOWYtM2Q1Mzk1YzJlM2U5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"datePublished":"2007-07-24","description":"A law school graduate becomes the protégée of a successful high-stakes litigator.","keywords":"female protagonist,law,one word title,murder,trial","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0914387/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dead47548"},"dateCreated":"2008-09-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"You have to see it to believe how perfect it is.","reviewBody":"I expected it to be great, but not this perfect. It takes 'riveting' to a whole new level. The show manages to have so much going on but always kept me involved and wondering what these people were hiding, how they are connected, what twist was coming my way and most importantly, how the events we were seeing happen in the present were going to lead to the ominous and frightening glimpses we get to see of the not so distant future. There's a lot happening and a lot of mystery around every corner, but it never feels like it's wandering too far into an unknown direction or getting too far ahead of the viewer. It's clear that every scene has a purpose and the writers now exactly where they're going and how they're getting there. So whenever something happens that's a little bit over the viewer's head at that moment, you know that it's going to be explained all the way soon. Everything that happens comes together in the final picture. And the journey to that final picture is one of the most compelling I've ever taken. Each of the thirteen episodes brings a remarkable amount of believable character development that looking back to the first episode after finishing the finale, it seems like I began by watching completely different people. There is so much information, so much mystery, so many twists and turns that are so comfortably displayed with such raw intensity throughout. My eyes were glued to the screen the entire time, and every episode just had me aching for the next one. Genius stuff.\n\nThe acting more than deserved all of the immense praise that it received. Glenn Close gives a shatteringly intense performance that is frighteningly commanding. Rose Byrne is perfect as the one character who makes a huge change throughout the first season. She plays this transition from the gullible, naive new attorney to a hardened, revenge-driven women as if she were born to do it. I've loved her as an actress since I first laid eyes on her, but she still managed to impress me in a way I couldn't have imagined. She's never had a role this dark, this adult...gone through so many different levels of maturity and emotion without hesitating for a second. She holds her own against Close, and that is no easy task. We see her go from being a tool in Patty Hewes (Close's character) end game to being an almost mirror image of Hewes herself. Zeljko Ivanek is the cast member who surprised me the most, though. I've seen him in shows before (24, Oz) but he was never given the room to really display his immense talent like he was given in this one. He has a quiet intelligence to him that always drew my attention towards him on screen, and his character probably faces the most tragic journey throughout the first season. And he makes the southern drawl his character has seem as if it's been his voice since the day he came out of the womb. He deserved that Emmy and then some. Ted Danson, Noah Bean and Tate Donovan round out the main cast of this perfectly acted thriller.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":28221,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Biti Eve
programme.desc: Biti Eve je serija fokusirana na tinejdžerku, Evu Baxter i njene dnevne probleme. Njeni su roditelji razvedeni, ali žive jedno do drugog. Eve je bila zaljubljena u dječaka po imenu Adam, ali se ta... Biti Eve je serija fokusirana na tinejdžerku, Evu Baxter i njene dnevne probleme. Njeni su roditelji razvedeni, ali žive jedno do drugog. Eve je bila zaljubljena u dječaka po imenu Adam, ali se ta veza raspala. Ona završava sa jednim dečkom po imenu Sam Hooper, sa kojim se prvi put poljubila, još dok su bili djeca.

Emmit Stussy, "kralj parkirališta Minnesote", zgodan je, samoostvareni mogul nekretnina sa savršenom porodicom, prava američka priča o uspjehu. Ray je više upozoravajuća priča. Njihovo bratsko suparništvo vodi ih na krivi put koji počinje sitnim krađama, ali ubrzo dovodi do ubistava, mafijaša i surovog natjecateljskog bridža. Sitno suparništvo između dvojice braće eskalira i donosi haos maloj minesotskoj zajednici.

programme.title: Sajnfeld
programme.desc: Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet... Serija koja je počela kao svaki drugi sitkom, a izrasla u najkompleksnije televizijsko remek delo, krije se iza prezimena jednog stand up komičara. Sajnfeld je kultni naslov iza kojeg stoji devet Emija, tri Zlatna globusa i pregršt drugih nagrada, čiji je broj mali u odnosu na višemilionski auditorijum koji je svake nedelje sedeo pred televizijskih ekrana kako bi video šta to njemu večeras na tako smešan i komičan način, smeta. Džeri je komičar koji ima najboljeg prijatelja, bivšu devojku koja mu postaje najbolja prijateljica i komšiju koji mu postaje deo života. Itekako mu ide sa ženama, ali nijedna mu ne odgovara: ili ima veliki nos, ili je prelepa, ali ne baš pod svakim svetlom itd...ali vremenom mu sve to postaje dosadno i odluči da menja svoj život.

credits.actor: Denis Leary, Michael Lombardi, Steven Pasquale, Andrea Roth, John Scurti, Daniel Sunjata, Callie Thorne, Natalie Distler

programme.title: Opasna igra
programme.desc: Radnja serije prati brilijantnu ali istovrmeno nemilosrdnu advokaticu Peti Hjuz, njenu štićenicu Elen Parsons i advokatsku kancelariju Hjuz u Njujorku. Upoznajte mladu, inteligentnu, ambicioznu i diplomiranu pravnicu, Elen Parsons (Rouz Birne) koja je postala štićenica Patricije Hivs (Glen Klouz), nemilosrdne advokatice s dugogodišnjim iskustvom, kojoj baš ništa ne predstavlja prepreku do dobijanja parnice. Peti je osoba kojoj ne sme ništa stati na put, jer ona će manipulacijom i dobrom, ali i opasnom strategijom doći do svog cilja.

programme.title: Biti Eve
programme.desc: Biti Eve je serija fokusirana na tinejdžerku, Evu Baxter i njene dnevne probleme. Njeni su roditelji razvedeni, ali žive jedno do drugog. Eve je bila zaljubljena u dječaka po imenu Adam, ali se ta... Biti Eve je serija fokusirana na tinejdžerku, Evu Baxter i njene dnevne probleme. Njeni su roditelji razvedeni, ali žive jedno do drugog. Eve je bila zaljubljena u dječaka po imenu Adam, ali se ta veza raspala. Ona završava sa jednim dečkom po imenu Sam Hooper, sa kojim se prvi put poljubila, još dok su bili djeca.

programme.title: Monk Mali Pas
programme.desc: Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli. Monk je veseli mali pas koji uporno daje sve od sebe, ali uvijek pogriješi! Kad stvari krenu po zlu za Monka, slijedi katastrofa jer sve vrlo lako može brzo izmaknuti kontroli.

credits.actor: Bob Odenkirk, Rhea Seehorn, Jonathan Banks, Michael McKean, Patrick Fabian, Michael Mando, Julie Ann Emery, Jeremy Shamos

programme.title: I dalje radimo non stop
programme.desc: David Jason ponovo je trgovac Grenvile, koji je nasledio mali dućan od voljenog, ali škrtog ujaka Arkvrajta. Grenvile sada vodi dućan zajedno sa svojim veselim i zgodnim sinom Lirojem, koji se rodio... David Jason ponovo je trgovac Grenvile, koji je nasledio mali dućan od voljenog, ali škrtog ujaka Arkvrajta. Grenvile sada vodi dućan zajedno sa svojim veselim i zgodnim sinom Lirojem, koji se rodio iz kratkog ljubavnog susreta od pre dvadesetak godina. Grenvile je i dalje na usluzi zajednici na svoj neponovljivi način. Željan zarade, Grenvile smišlja razne nepromišljene planove za podsticanje kupaca da ostave što više novca, ali retko kad postiže očekivane rezultate. Liroju ne nedostaje ženske pažnje, a Grenvilovo udvaranje staroj ljubavi Mavis stalno ometa njena žestoko zaštitnička sestra Madž. Tu je i uvek prisutna Crna Udovica, koja je takođe bacila oko na Grenvila, čini se.

programme.title: Škorpija
programme.desc: Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine:... Serija se temelji na istinitoj priči i prati genija Voltera O'Brajena (Elyes Gabel) i njegovog tima sjajnih čudesa koji se bore protiv složenih visokotehnoloških prijetnji modernog vremena. Tim čine: Tobi Kurtis (Eddie Kaye Thomas), fini bihevioralista; Hapi Kin (Jadyn Wong) vunderkind za mehaniku i Silvester Dod (Ari Stidham), odličan statističar. Iako se međusobno odlično razumiju, vanjski svijet je za njih zagonetka. Srećom, Pejdž Dinin (Katharine McPhee) ima mladog sina koji će ih "prevesti" u vanjski svijet. Svi pobjeđuju s ovim timom: svojom izuzetnom domišljatošću rješavaju nacionalne krize, pomažući sebi da se uklope u stvarni svijet.
